001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
004import java.net.URI;
005import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.Comparator;
009import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
010import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.Map;
013import java.util.Objects;
014import java.util.Properties;
015import java.util.Set;
016import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
017import java.util.function.BiFunction;
018import java.util.function.Function;
019import java.util.function.Supplier;
020import java.util.regex.Matcher;
021import java.util.regex.Pattern;
022
023import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
024
025import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.ChangePublisher.ChangeType;
026import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties;
027import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.MutableLogProperties;
028import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
029import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
030
031/**
032 * Provides String based properties like {@link System#getProperty(String)} for default
033 * configuration of logging levels and output. Since Rainbow Gum is configuration agnostic
034 * LogProperties is a simple string key and string value interface to allow almost any
035 * configuration implementation. The only required method to implement is
036 * {@link #valueOrNull(String)} and thus LogProperties is a functional like interface but
037 * using {@link LogProperties#builder()} is preferred so that a
038 * {@linkplain #description(String) description} can be added.
039 * <p>
040 * If a custom {@link LogProperties} is not configured the default RainbowGum uses System
041 * properties.
042 * <p>
043 * The built-in properties to configure RainbowGum are modeled after <a href=
044 * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.1.0/reference/html/features.html#features.logging">
045 * Spring Boot logging </a>
046 * <p>
047 * LogProperties should generally be accessed with the {@link LogProperty.PropertyGetter}
048 * and {@link LogProperty.Property} like-monads which will allow safe
049 * <em>programmatic</em> data conversion of the flat key values and useful error messages
050 * to users if the property cannot be mapped or is missing. For more <em>declarative</em>
051 * injection of properties see {@link LogConfigurable} which will generate builders that
052 * can use LogProperties.
053 * <p>
054 * Rainbow Gum treats {@value #SEP} in the keys as special separator analogous to
055 * JavaScript/JSON and various other configuration systems. Furthermore to work with a
056 * wide set of configuration systems once a property key has a value it is
057 * <strong>RECOMMENDED</strong> that there should not be other property key value with a
058 * key that is a prefix of the previously mentioned key. For example allowing two
059 * properties <code>logging.example=stuff</code>, <code>logging.example.a=A</code> is not
060 * recommended as <code>logging.example</code> is defined as a leaf. The exception to this
061 * rule is logging levels mapped to logger names for consistency with Spring Boot.
062 * <p>
063 * Rainbow Gum out of the the box supports parsing two formats into properties:
064 * {@link Properties} text, and {@link URI#getRawQuery()} percent encoded query
065 * parameters. The two different formats have different behavior for
066 * {@link #listOrNull(String)} and {@link #mapOrNull(String)}. If a custom format of
067 * LogProperties is created those two methods may need to be extended.
068 * <p>
069 * A convention used through out Rainbow Gum is to have the property names as constants as
070 * it makes documentation easier. These constants name are suffixed with
071 * <code>_PROPERTY</code> or <code>_PREFIX</code> the former being a fully qualified key
072 * that maybe parameterized and the latter being a partial key ending with
073 * "<code>.</code>". The fully qualified keys are like leaves on a tree.
074 * <p>
075 * Property keys can be parameterized by using
076 * {@link LogProperties#interpolateKey(String, Map)} and a general pattern is
077 * <code>logging.component.{name}.prop</code> where {@value #NAME} is a parameter. Many
078 * property constants use this to allow multiple configuration of components by name.
079 *
080 * <table class="table">
081 * <caption><strong>Built-in Property Patterns</strong></caption>
082 * <tr>
083 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
084 * <th>Description</th>
085 * </tr>
086 * <tr>
087 * <td>{@value #LEVEL_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = LEVEL</td>
088 * <td>Sets the level for the logger. If logger name is missing then it is considered the
089 * root logger. {@link Level#INFO} is the default level for the root logger.</td>
090 * </tr>
091 * <tr>
092 * <td>{@value #CHANGE_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = boolean |
093 * List&lt;{@link ChangeType}&gt;</td>
094 * <td>Allows runtime changing of levels for the logger. By design RainbowGum does not
095 * allow loggers to change levels once initialized. This configuration will allow the
096 * level to be changed for the logger and its children and by default is false as the
097 * built-in {@link LogProperties} is generally static (system properties).</td>
098 * </tr>
099 * <tr>
100 * <td>{@value #ROUTES_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
101 * <td>A comma separated list of routes that should be enabled. If not set
102 * {@value LogRouter.Router#DEFAULT_ROUTER_NAME } is the default.</td>
103 * </tr>
104 * <tr>
105 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
106 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders associated with the route. If not set
107 * {@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} is used.</td>
108 * </tr>
109 * <tr>
110 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY} = <code>URI</code></td>
111 * <td>Looks up a publisher by URI scheme using the {@link LogPublisherRegistry}. The
112 * publisher is then configured by properties with {@value #PUBLISHER_PREFIX}.</td>
113 * </tr>
114 * <tr>
115 * <td>{@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
116 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders that should be enabled. If not set
117 * {@value LogAppender#CONSOLE_APPENDER_NAME} is the default.</td>
118 * </tr>
119 * <tr>
120 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
121 * <td>Looks up an output by URI scheme using the {@link LogOutputRegistry}. The output is
122 * then configured by properties with {@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX}.</td>
123 * </tr>
124 * <tr>
125 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
126 * <td>Looks up an encoder by URI scheme using the {@link LogEncoderRegistry}. The encoder
127 * is then configured by properties with {@value #ENCODER_PREFIX}.</td>
128 * </tr>
129 * <tr>
130 * <tr>
131 * <td>{@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
132 * <td>Configures the named output. The name of the output usually comes from the
133 * appender.</td>
134 * </tr>
135 * <tr>
136 * <td>{@value #ENCODER_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
137 * <td>Configures the named encoder. The name of the encoder usually comes from the
138 * appender.</td>
139 * </tr>
140 * <tr>
141 * <td>{@value #FILE_PROPERTY} = URI</td>
142 * <td>A URI or file path to log to a file. This is for Spring Boot compatibility.</td>
143 * </tr>
144 * </table>
145 *
146 * @see LogConfigurable
147 */
148public interface LogProperties {
149
150        /**
151         * properties separator.
152         */
153        static final String SEP = ".";
154
155        /**
156         * Logging properties prefix.
157         */
158        static final String ROOT_PREFIX = "logging" + SEP;
159
160        /**
161         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
162         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
163         */
164        static final String LEVEL_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "level";
165
166        /**
167         * Logging change configuration allowed property.
168         */
169        static final String GLOBAL_CHANGE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.change";
170
171        /**
172         * Will globally turn of any ANSI escape output as well disable extensions that do
173         * things for ANSI escape like JANSI.
174         */
175        static final String GLOBAL_ANSI_DISABLE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.ansi.disable";
176
177        /**
178         * Logging change properties prefix.
179         */
180        static final String CHANGE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "change";
181
182        /**
183         * Logging file property for default single file appending. The value should be a URI.
184         */
185        static final String FILE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "file.name";
186
187        /**
188         * A common key parameter is called name.
189         */
190        static final String NAME = "name";
191
192        /**
193         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
194         */
195        static final String OUTPUT_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "output.{" + NAME + "}.";
196
197        /**
198         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
199         */
200        static final String ENCODER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "encoder.{" + NAME + "}.";
201
202        /**
203         * Enabled Logging appenders. The value should be a list of names. This is equivalent
204         * to {@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} with name "default".
205         */
206        static final String APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "appenders";
207
208        /**
209         * Logging appender prefix for configuration.
210         */
211        static final String APPENDER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "appender.{" + NAME + "}.";
212
213        /**
214         * Output appender property.
215         */
216        static final String APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "output";
217
218        /**
219         * Encoder appender property.
220         */
221        static final String APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "encoder";
222
223        /**
224         * Logging publisher prefix for configuration.
225         */
226        static final String PUBLISHER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "publisher.{" + NAME + "}.";
227
228        /**
229         * Routes enabled with names comma separated.
230         */
231        static final String ROUTES_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "routes";
232
233        /**
234         * Route prefix for configuration.
235         */
236        static final String ROUTE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "route.{" + NAME + "}.";
237
238        /**
239         * Logging publisher URI property.
240         */
241        static final String ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "publisher";
242
243        /**
244         * Appenders associated with a route comma separated.
245         */
246        static final String ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "appenders";
247
248        /**
249         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
250         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
251         */
252        static final String ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX = ROUTE_PREFIX + "level";
253
254        /**
255         * Route flags.
256         */
257        static final String ROUTE_FLAGS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "flags";
258
259        /**
260         * Analogous to {@link System#getProperty(String)}.
261         * @param key property name.
262         * @return property value.
263         */
264        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key);
265
266        /**
267         * Gets a list or null if the key is missing and by default uses
268         * {@link #parseList(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
269         * as a list using {@link LogProperties#parseList(String)} but custom implementations
270         * may rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing
271         * configuration system.
272         * @param key property name.
273         * @return list or <code>null</code>.
274         * @apiNote the reason empty list is not returned for missing key is that it creates
275         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
276         */
277        default @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
278                String s = valueOrNull(key);
279                if (s == null) {
280                        return null;
281                }
282                return parseList(s);
283        }
284
285        /**
286         * Gets a map or null if the key is missing and by default uses
287         * {@link #parseMap(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
288         * as map using {@link LogProperties#parseMap(String)} but custom implementations may
289         * rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing configuration
290         * system.
291         * @param key property name.
292         * @return map or <code>null</code>.
293         * @apiNote the reason empty map is not returned for missing key is that it creates
294         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
295         */
296        default @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
297                String s = valueOrNull(key);
298                if (s == null) {
299                        return null;
300                }
301                return parseMap(s);
302        }
303
304        /**
305         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
306         * values. The first value not missing (not <code>null</code>) will be returned.
307         * @param root prefix.
308         * @param key should start with prefix.
309         * @return closest value or <code>null</code> if no value can be found.
310         * @see #findUpPathOrNull(String, Function)
311         */
312        default @Nullable String findOrNull(String root, String key) {
313                return findOrNull(root, key, (p, k) -> p.valueOrNull(k));
314        }
315
316        /**
317         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
318         * values. The first value not missing (not <code>null</code>) will be returned.
319         * @param <T> result type
320         * @param root prefix.
321         * @param key should start with prefix.
322         * @param func convert function where <code>null</code> return means to keep
323         * searching.
324         * @return closest value or <code>null</code> if no value can be found.
325         * @see #findUpPathOrNull(String, Function)
326         */
327        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
328        default <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T findOrNull(String root, String key,
329                        BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
330                return findUpPathOrNull(key, k -> func.apply(this, concatKey(root, k)));
331        }
332
333        /**
334         * Describes a key and by default is usually just the key.
335         * @param key key.
336         * @return usually the key.
337         */
338        default String description(String key) {
339                return key;
340        }
341
342        /**
343         * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A higher
344         * number gives higher precedence.
345         * @return zero by default.
346         */
347        default int order() {
348                return 0;
349        }
350
351        /**
352         * Abstract log properties builder.
353         *
354         * @param <T> builder.
355         * @apiNote this abstract class can largely be ignored hence why it is sealed.
356         */
357        public sealed abstract class AbstractBuilder<T> {
358
359                /**
360                 * description
361                 */
362                protected @Nullable String description = null;
363
364                /**
365                 * order
366                 */
367                protected int order = 0;
368
369                /**
370                 * rename key
371                 */
372                protected Function<String, String> renameKey = s -> s;
373
374                /**
375                 * fallbacks
376                 */
377                protected List<LogProperties> fallbacks = new ArrayList<>();
378
379                /**
380                 * Ignored.
381                 */
382                protected AbstractBuilder() {
383                }
384
385                /**
386                 * Add a fallback properties.
387                 * @param properties fallback not null.
388                 * @return this.
389                 */
390                public T with(LogProperties properties) {
391                        this.fallbacks.add(properties);
392                        return self();
393                }
394
395                /**
396                 * For returning this.
397                 * @return this builder.
398                 */
399                protected abstract T self();
400
401                /**
402                 * Description for properties.
403                 * @param description not null.
404                 * @return this.
405                 */
406                public T description(String description) {
407                        this.description = description;
408                        return self();
409                }
410
411                /**
412                 * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A
413                 * higher number gives higher precedence.
414                 * @param order order.
415                 * @return this.
416                 */
417                public T order(int order) {
418                        this.order = order;
419                        return self();
420                }
421
422                /**
423                 * Renames the key before it accesses function.
424                 * @param renameKey rename key function.
425                 * @return this.
426                 */
427                public T renameKey(Function<String, String> renameKey) {
428                        this.renameKey = renameKey;
429                        return self();
430                }
431
432                /**
433                 * Removes the prefix from a key before it accesses the underlying properties.
434                 * @param prefix to be removed from start of key.
435                 * @return this.
436                 */
437                public T removeKeyPrefix(String prefix) {
438                        return renameKey(k -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(k, prefix));
439                }
440
441        }
442
443        /**
444         * Builder for properties.
445         */
446        public final static class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
447
448                private @Nullable Function<Builder, LogProperties> provider = null;
449
450                private Builder() {
451                }
452
453                @Override
454                protected Builder self() {
455                        return this;
456                }
457
458                private Builder provider(Function<Builder, LogProperties> provider) {
459                        if (this.provider != null) {
460                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("from already set");
461                        }
462                        this.provider = provider;
463                        return this;
464                }
465
466                /**
467                 * Sets what is called on {@link LogProperties#valueOrNull(String)}.
468                 * @param function valueOrNull func.
469                 * @return this.
470                 */
471                public Builder fromFunction(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<String, @Nullable String> function) {
472                        return provider((b) -> new DefaultLogProperties(function,
473                                        Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "function"), renameKey, order));
474                }
475
476                /**
477                 * Parses a string as {@link Properties}.
478                 * @param properties properties as a string.
479                 * @return this.
480                 */
481                public Builder fromProperties(String properties) {
482                        if (description == null) {
483                                description = "Properties String";
484                        }
485                        return fromFunction(PropertiesParser.readProperties(properties)::get);
486                }
487
488                /**
489                 * Parses a string as a URI query string. If the URI has no query portion then it
490                 * will be equivalent to empty properties.
491                 * @param uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and key
492                 * value separator of "<code>=</code>".
493                 * @return this.
494                 */
495                public Builder fromURIQuery(URI uri) {
496                        String query = uri.getRawQuery();
497                        return provider(
498                                        (b) -> queryToProperties(query, Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "URI_QUERY(" + uri + ")")));
499                }
500
501                /**
502                 * Parses a string as a URI query string.
503                 * @param query uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and
504                 * key value separator of "<code>=</code>".
505                 * @return this.
506                 */
507                public Builder fromURIQuery(String query) {
508                        return provider((b) -> queryToProperties(query,
509                                        Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "URI_QUERY(" + query + ")")));
510
511                }
512
513                private MultiMapProperties queryToProperties(@Nullable String query, String description) {
514                        Map<String, List<String>> multiMap;
515                        if (query == null) {
516                                multiMap = Map.of();
517                        }
518                        else {
519                                multiMap = parseMultiMap(query);
520                        }
521                        var properties = new MultiMapProperties(multiMap, description, renameKey, order);
522                        return properties;
523                }
524
525                /**
526                 * Builds LogProperties based on builder config.
527                 * @return this.
528                 */
529                public LogProperties build() {
530                        var f = this.provider;
531                        if (f == null) {
532                                if (!fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
533                                        return LogProperties.of(fallbacks);
534                                }
535                                throw new IllegalStateException("from was not set");
536                        }
537
538                        var first = f.apply(this);
539                        if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
540                                return first;
541                        }
542                        List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
543                        combined.add(first);
544                        combined.addAll(fallbacks);
545                        return LogProperties.of(combined);
546                }
547
548                static abstract class AbstractLogProperties implements LogProperties {
549
550                        protected final String description;
551
552                        protected final Function<String, String> renameKey;
553
554                        protected final int order;
555
556                        public AbstractLogProperties(String description, Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
557                                super();
558                                this.description = description;
559                                this.renameKey = renameKey;
560                                this.order = order;
561                        }
562
563                        @Override
564                        public int order() {
565                                return this.order;
566                        }
567
568                        @Override
569                        public String description(String key) {
570                                String rename = renameKey.apply(key);
571                                String desc = "'" + key + "' from " + description;
572                                if (!rename.equals(key)) {
573                                        desc += "[" + rename + "]";
574                                }
575                                return desc;
576                        }
577
578                        @Override
579                        public String toString() {
580                                return getClass().getSimpleName() + "[description='" + description + "', " + "order=" + order + "]";
581                        }
582
583                }
584
585                private static final class DefaultLogProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
586
587                        private final Function<String, @Nullable String> func;
588
589                        public DefaultLogProperties(Function<String, @Nullable String> func, String description,
590                                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
591                                super(description, renameKey, order);
592                                this.func = func;
593                        }
594
595                        @Override
596                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
597                                return func.apply(renameKey.apply(key));
598                        }
599
600                }
601
602        }
603
604        /**
605         * A log properties that can be mutated like a map.
606         */
607        public interface MutableLogProperties extends LogProperties {
608
609                /**
610                 * Assigns key to a value.
611                 * @param key key.
612                 * @param value value if null will remove the key.
613                 * @return this.
614                 */
615                MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value);
616
617                /**
618                 * Copy java.util {@link Properties} String useful for unit testing.
619                 * @param content string in {@link Properties} format (tip use multiline strings).
620                 * @return this.
621                 */
622                default MutableLogProperties copyProperties(String content) {
623                        var m = PropertiesParser.readProperties(content);
624                        for (var e : m.entrySet()) {
625                                put(e.getKey(), e.getKey());
626                        }
627                        return this;
628                }
629
630                /**
631                 * Builder for MutableLogProperties.
632                 * @return builder.
633                 */
634                public static Builder builder() {
635                        return new Builder();
636                }
637
638                /**
639                 * Mutable Log properties builder.
640                 */
641                public final class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
642
643                        private Map<String, String> map = new LinkedHashMap<>();
644
645                        private Builder() {
646                        }
647
648                        @Override
649                        protected Builder self() {
650                                return this;
651                        }
652
653                        /**
654                         * Sets the backing mutable map.
655                         * @param map backing map.
656                         * @return this.
657                         */
658                        public Builder with(Map<String, String> map) {
659                                this.map = map;
660                                return this;
661                        }
662
663                        /**
664                         * Parses a string as {@link Properties} useful for unit testing with Java
665                         * multiline string literal.
666                         * @param properties properties as a string.
667                         * @return this.
668                         */
669                        public Builder copyProperties(String properties) {
670                                map.putAll(PropertiesParser.readProperties(properties));
671                                return this;
672                        }
673
674                        /**
675                         * Builds a mutable log properties.
676                         * @return mutable log properties.
677                         */
678                        public MutableLogProperties build() {
679                                String description = this.description;
680                                if (description == null) {
681                                        description = "custom mutable";
682                                }
683                                var first = new MapLogProperties(map, description, renameKey, order);
684                                if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
685                                        return first;
686                                }
687                                List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
688                                combined.add(first);
689                                combined.addAll(fallbacks);
690                                return new CompositeMutableLogProperties(sort(combined));
691                        }
692
693                        private static final class MapLogProperties extends LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties
694                                        implements MutableLogProperties {
695
696                                private final Map<String, String> map;
697
698                                public MapLogProperties(Map<String, String> map, String description, Function<String, String> renameKey,
699                                                int order) {
700                                        super(description, renameKey, order);
701                                        this.map = map;
702                                }
703
704                                @Override
705                                public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
706                                        return map.get(renameKey.apply(key));
707                                }
708
709                                @Override
710                                public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
711                                        Objects.requireNonNull(key);
712                                        key = renameKey.apply(key);
713                                        if (value == null) {
714                                                map.remove(key);
715                                                return this;
716                                        }
717                                        map.put(key, value);
718                                        return this;
719                                }
720
721                        }
722
723                }
724
725        }
726
727        /**
728         * LogProperties builder.
729         * @return builder.
730         */
731        public static Builder builder() {
732                return new Builder();
733        }
734
735        /**
736         * Finds global properties by checking the currently bound rainbow gum and if not set
737         * use system properties. <strong>This method should be used sparingly and is
738         * preferred that you get the properties through a config instance instead.</strong>
739         * @return currently bound properties or system properties.
740         * @apiNote the intention of this method is to be used for ServiceLoader singleton
741         * components and other systems that maybe bound prior to rainbow gum loading that
742         * need to determine if they should be enabled.
743         */
744        public static LogProperties findGlobalProperties() {
745                return findGlobalProperties(() -> StandardProperties.SYSTEM_PROPERTIES);
746        }
747
748        /**
749         * Finds global properties by checking the currently bound rainbow gum and if not set
750         * use the supplier as the fallback. <strong>This method should be used sparingly and
751         * is preferred that you get the properties through a config instance
752         * instead.</strong>
753         * @param fallback supplier to use if no rainbow gum is bound.
754         * @return currently bound properties or fallback.
755         * @apiNote the intention of this method is to be used for ServiceLoader singleton
756         * components and other systems that maybe bound prior to rainbow gum loading that
757         * need to determine if they should be enabled.
758         */
759        public static LogProperties findGlobalProperties(Supplier<? extends LogProperties> fallback) {
760                var gum = RainbowGum.getOrNull();
761                if (gum != null) {
762                        return gum.config().properties();
763                }
764                return Objects.requireNonNull(fallback.get());
765        }
766
767        /**
768         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
769         * @param logProperties list of properties.
770         * @param fallback if the logProperties list is empty.
771         * @return log properties
772         */
773        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties, LogProperties fallback) {
774                if (logProperties.isEmpty()) {
775                        return fallback;
776                }
777                if (logProperties.size() == 1) {
778                        return Objects.requireNonNull(logProperties.get(0));
779                }
780                var array = sort(logProperties);
781                return new CompositeLogProperties(array);
782        }
783
784        private static LogProperties[] sort(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
785                @SuppressWarnings("null") // TODO eclipse array issue
786                LogProperties[] array = logProperties.stream()
787                        .filter(p -> p != StandardProperties.EMPTY)
788                        .toArray(size -> new LogProperties[size]);
789                Arrays.sort(array, Comparator.comparingInt(LogProperties::order).reversed());
790                return array;
791        }
792
793        /**
794         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
795         * @param logProperties the list of properties.
796         * @return if the logProperties is empty {@link StandardProperties#EMPTY} will be
797         * used.
798         */
799        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
800                return of(logProperties, StandardProperties.EMPTY);
801        }
802
803        /**
804         * Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for
805         * URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
806         * @param uri query will be used to pull properties from using
807         * {@link #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)}.
808         * @param prefix part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI
809         * properties.
810         * @param properties usually this is the properties coming from {@link LogConfig}.
811         * @return combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query
812         * parameters.
813         */
814        public static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties) {
815                String query = uri.getRawQuery();
816                query = query == null ? "" : query;
817                var uriProperties = LogProperties.builder()
818                        .description("URI(" + uri + ")")
819                        .fromURIQuery(query)
820                        .renameKey(s -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(s, prefix))
821                        .build();
822                return LogProperties.of(List.of(properties, uriProperties));
823        }
824
825        /**
826         * Parse a {@linkplain URI#getRawQuery() URI query} in <a href=
827         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
828         * application/x-www-form-urlencoded </a> format useful for parsing properties values
829         * that have key values embedded in them. <strong>This parser unlike form encoding
830         * uses <code>%20</code> for space as the data is coming from a URI.</strong>
831         * @param query raw query component of URI.
832         * @param consumer accept will be called for each entry and if key (left hand) does
833         * not have a "<code>=</code>" following it the second parameter on the consumer
834         * accept will be passed <code>null</code>.
835         */
836        public static void parseUriQuery(String query,
837                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
838                parseUriQuery(query, true, consumer);
839        }
840
841        /**
842         * Parses a URI query formatted string to a Map.
843         * @param query raw query component of URI.
844         * @return decoded key values with last key winning over previous equal keys.
845         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
846         */
847        public static Map<String, String> parseMap(String query) {
848                Map<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
849                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> {
850                        if (v != null) {
851                                m.put(k, v);
852                        }
853                });
854                return m;
855        }
856
857        /**
858         * Parses a URI query for a multiple value map. The list values of the map maybe empty
859         * if the query parameter does not have any values associated with it which would be
860         * the case if there is a parameter (key) with no "<code>=</code>" following it. For
861         * example the following would have three entries of <code>a,b,c</code> all with empty
862         * list: <pre>
863         * <code>
864         * a&amp;b&amp;c&amp;
865         * </code> </pre>
866         * @param query raw query component of URI.
867         * @return decoded key values with multiple keys grouped together in order found.
868         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
869         */
870        public static Map<String, List<String>> parseMultiMap(String query) {
871                Map<String, List<String>> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
872                BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> f = (k, v) -> {
873                        List<String> list = Objects.requireNonNull(m.computeIfAbsent(k, _k -> new ArrayList<String>()));
874                        if (v != null) {
875                                list.add(v);
876                        }
877                };
878                parseUriQuery(query, f);
879                return m;
880        }
881
882        /**
883         * Parses a list of strings from a string that is <a href=
884         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
885         * percent encoded for escaping (application/x-www-form-urlencoded)</a> where the
886         * separator can be either "<code>&amp;</code>" or "<code>,</code>".
887         * <p>
888         * An example would be using ampersand: <pre><code>
889         *  "a&amp;b%20B&amp;c" -> ["a","b B","c"]
890         *  </code> </pre> and comma: <pre><code>
891         *  "a,b,c" -> ["a","b","c"]
892         *  </code> </pre>
893         * @param query the comma or ampersand delimited string that is in URI query format.
894         * @return list of strings
895         */
896        public static List<String> parseList(String query) {
897                List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
898                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> list.add(k));
899                return list;
900        }
901
902        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
903                parseUriQuery(query, decode, "[&,]", consumer);
904        }
905
906        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, String sep,
907                        BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
908                /*
909                 * TODO default java split has issues but is very fast
910                 */
911                @SuppressWarnings("StringSplitter")
912                String[] pairs = query.split(sep);
913                for (String pair : pairs) {
914                        int idx = pair.indexOf("=");
915                        String key;
916                        String value;
917                        if (idx == 0) {
918                                continue;
919                        }
920                        else if (idx < 0) {
921                                key = pair;
922                                value = null;
923                        }
924                        else {
925                                key = pair.substring(0, idx);
926                                value = pair.substring(idx + 1);
927                        }
928                        if (decode) {
929                                key = PercentCodec.decode(key, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
930                                if (value != null) {
931                                        value = PercentCodec.decode(value, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
932                                }
933
934                        }
935                        if (key.isBlank()) {
936                                continue;
937                        }
938                        consumer.accept(key, value);
939                }
940        }
941
942        /**
943         * Common static log properties such as System properties ane environment variables.
944         */
945        @CaseChanging
946        enum StandardProperties implements LogProperties {
947
948                /**
949                 * Empty properties. The order is <code>-1</code>.
950                 */
951                EMPTY {
952                        @Override
953                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
954                                return null;
955                        }
956
957                        @Override
958                        public int order() {
959                                return -1;
960                        }
961                },
962                /**
963                 * Uses {@link System#getProperty(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}. The
964                 * {@link #order()} is <code>400</code> which the same value as MicroProfile
965                 * config ordinal.
966                 */
967                SYSTEM_PROPERTIES {
968                        @Override
969                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
970                                return System.getProperty(key);
971                        }
972
973                        @Override
974                        public int order() {
975                                return 400;
976                        }
977                },
978                /**
979                 * Uses {@link System#getenv(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}.The
980                 * {@link #order()} is <code>300</code> which is the same value as MicroProfile
981                 * config ordinal.
982                 */
983                ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES {
984                        @Override
985                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
986                                return System.getenv(translateKey(key));
987                        }
988
989                        @Override
990                        protected String translateKey(String key) {
991                                return key.replace(".", "_");
992                        }
993
994                };
995
996                @Override
997                public String description(String key) {
998                        String k = translateKey(key);
999                        String description = "'" + key + "' from " + name();
1000                        if (!k.equals(key)) {
1001                                description += "[" + k + "]";
1002                        }
1003                        return description;
1004                }
1005
1006                /**
1007                 * Translate the key.
1008                 * @param key input
1009                 * @return output
1010                 */
1011                protected String translateKey(String key) {
1012                        return key;
1013                }
1014
1015        }
1016
1017        /**
1018         * Searches a {@value LogProperties#SEP} separated property path recursing up the path
1019         * till a non null value (not missing) is found.
1020         * <p>
1021         * For example assume we have a single property set like
1022         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff=DEBUG</code> and we call this function with
1023         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code>.
1024         * <ol>
1025         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1026         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1027         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff</code> will resolve to <code>"DEBUG"</code>, stop
1028         * and return <code>"DEBUG"</code>.</li>
1029         * </ol>
1030         * @param <T> type to return.
1031         * @param key the initial path.
1032         * @param resolveFunc function that returns the value at path or <code>null</code>.
1033         * @return value or <code>null</code> if no non null value can be found.
1034         */
1035        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
1036        public static <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T findUpPathOrNull(String key,
1037                        Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc) {
1038                return searchPath(key, resolveFunc, SEP);
1039        }
1040
1041        private static <T> @Nullable T searchPath(String key, Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc, String sep) {
1042                String tempName = key;
1043                @Nullable
1044                T level = null;
1045                int indexOfLastDot = tempName.length();
1046                while ((level == null) && (indexOfLastDot > -1)) {
1047                        tempName = tempName.substring(0, indexOfLastDot);
1048                        level = resolveFunc.apply(tempName);
1049                        indexOfLastDot = tempName.lastIndexOf(sep);
1050                }
1051                if (level != null) {
1052                        return level;
1053                }
1054                return resolveFunc.apply("");
1055        }
1056
1057        /**
1058         * Concats a key using {@link #SEP} to the root prefix.
1059         * @param name key.
1060         * @return concat key.
1061         */
1062        static String concatKey(String name) {
1063                return concatKey(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX, name);
1064        }
1065
1066        /**
1067         * Concats a keys using {@link #SEP} as the separator.
1068         * @param prefix start of key.
1069         * @param name second part of key.
1070         * @return key.
1071         */
1072        static String concatKey(String prefix, String name) {
1073                if (name.equals("")) {
1074                        return prefix;
1075                }
1076                if (prefix.equals("")) {
1077                        return name;
1078                }
1079                if (prefix.endsWith(".")) {
1080                        prefix = prefix.substring(0, prefix.length() - 1);
1081                }
1082                if (name.startsWith(SEP)) {
1083                        return prefix + name;
1084                }
1085                return prefix + SEP + name;
1086        }
1087
1088        /**
1089         * Replace "{name}" tokens in property names.
1090         * @param key property name.
1091         * @param parameters tokens to replace with entry values.
1092         * @return interpolated property key.
1093         */
1094        static String interpolateKey(String key, Map<String, String> parameters) {
1095                for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : parameters.entrySet()) {
1096                        key = key.replace("{" + entry.getKey() + "}", entry.getValue());
1097                }
1098                return key;
1099        }
1100
1101        /**
1102         * Interpolates a named key which is a property key that has a {@value #NAME}.
1103         * @param key with name parameters.
1104         * @param name replace name token.
1105         * @return interpolated property key.
1106         */
1107        static String interpolateNamedKey(String key, String name) {
1108                return interpolateKey(key, Map.of(NAME, name));
1109        }
1110
1111        /**
1112         * Remove key prefix from the key. Prefix should end in "." but this method does not
1113         * check that.
1114         * @param key key whose prefix will be removed.
1115         * @param prefix property name prefix.
1116         * @return prefix removed if the string is prefixed.
1117         */
1118        static String removeKeyPrefix(String key, String prefix) {
1119                if (key.startsWith(prefix)) {
1120                        return key.substring(prefix.length());
1121                }
1122                return key;
1123        }
1124
1125        /**
1126         * Property prefix parameter pattern.
1127         */
1128        static final Pattern PARAMETER_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\{(.*?)\\}");
1129
1130        /**
1131         * Extract key parameters with {@link #PARAMETER_PATTERN}.
1132         * @param key also known as property name.
1133         * @return parameters in key.
1134         */
1135        static Set<String> keyParameters(String key) {
1136                Set<String> tokens = new LinkedHashSet<>();
1137                Matcher matcher = PARAMETER_PATTERN.matcher(key);
1138                while (matcher.find()) {
1139                        var t = matcher.group(1);
1140                        if (t == null) {
1141                                throw new IllegalStateException("bug with parameter pattern regex.");
1142                        }
1143                        tokens.add(t);
1144                }
1145                return tokens;
1146        }
1147
1148        /**
1149         * Validate key parameters.
1150         * @param key key to be interpolated with parameters
1151         * @param parameters names of parameters.
1152         */
1153        static void validateKeyParameters(String key, Set<String> parameters) {
1154                var keyParameters = keyParameters(key);
1155                if (!parameters.equals(keyParameters)) {
1156                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keyed parameter mismatch. key is parameters: " + keyParameters
1157                                        + " provided parameters: " + parameters);
1158                }
1159        }
1160
1161}
1162
1163final class MultiMapProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
1164
1165        private final Map<String, List<String>> multiMap;
1166
1167        public MultiMapProperties(Map<String, List<String>> multiMap, String description,
1168                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
1169                super(description, renameKey, order);
1170                this.multiMap = multiMap;
1171        }
1172
1173        @Override
1174        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1175                return _valueOrNull(renameKey.apply(key));
1176        }
1177
1178        private @Nullable String _valueOrNull(String key) {
1179                var list = multiMap.get(key);
1180                if (list == null || list.isEmpty()) {
1181                        return null;
1182                }
1183                return list.get(0);
1184        }
1185
1186        @Override
1187        public @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
1188                return multiMap.get(renameKey.apply(key));
1189        }
1190
1191        @Override
1192        public @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
1193                // var list = listOrNull(key);
1194                //
1195                // if (list != null) {
1196                // LinkedHashMap<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1197                // for (String k : list) {
1198                // String v = _valueOrNull(k);
1199                // if (v != null) {
1200                // m.put(k, v);
1201                // }
1202                // }
1203                // return m;
1204                // }
1205
1206                /*
1207                 * Now we check for dotted notation since key was not set. key.subkey=value
1208                 */
1209                String prefix = renameKey.apply(key) + LogProperties.SEP;
1210                LinkedHashMap<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1211                for (var k : multiMap.keySet()) {
1212                        if (k.startsWith(prefix) && !k.equals(prefix)) {
1213                                String v = _valueOrNull(k);
1214                                if (v != null) {
1215                                        String _k = k.substring(prefix.length());
1216                                        m.put(_k, v);
1217                                }
1218                        }
1219                }
1220                return m;
1221        }
1222
1223}
1224
1225interface ListLogProperties extends LogProperties {
1226
1227        @Override
1228        default @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1229                for (var props : properties()) {
1230                        var value = props.valueOrNull(key);
1231                        if (value != null) {
1232                                return value;
1233                        }
1234                }
1235                return null;
1236        }
1237
1238        @Override
1239        default String description(String key) {
1240                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1241                boolean first = true;
1242                for (var p : properties()) {
1243                        if (first) {
1244                                first = false;
1245                        }
1246                        else {
1247                                sb.append(", ");
1248                        }
1249                        sb.append(p.description(key));
1250                }
1251                return sb.toString();
1252        }
1253
1254        LogProperties[] properties();
1255
1256        default StringBuilder toString(StringBuilder sb) {
1257                sb.append(getClass().getSimpleName());
1258                sb.append("[properties=").append(Arrays.deepToString(properties())).append("]");
1259                return sb;
1260        }
1261
1262}
1263
1264record CompositeMutableLogProperties(LogProperties[] properties) implements ListLogProperties, MutableLogProperties {
1265
1266        @Override
1267        public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
1268                for (var p : properties()) {
1269                        if (p instanceof MutableLogProperties mp && mp != this) {
1270                                mp.put(key, value);
1271                                return this;
1272                        }
1273                }
1274                return this;
1275        }
1276
1277        @Override
1278        public String toString() {
1279                return toString(new StringBuilder()).toString();
1280        }
1281
1282}
1283
1284record CompositeLogProperties(LogProperties[] properties) implements ListLogProperties {
1285        @Override
1286        public String toString() {
1287                return toString(new StringBuilder()).toString();
1288        }
1289}
